titleStmt.title: A true account of the late actions betvveen the Confederate Army commanded by Prince Levvis of Baden, and that of the French, under Marishal De Lorge: wherein three thousand five hundred of the French were kill'd and wounded, with 1500 prisoners: many tinn boats, and two standards, &c. were taken. In a letter from Hailbron.

publicationStmt.publisher: Re-printed by the Heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to Their most Excellent Majesties,

notesStmt.note: Date a misprint; at head of title: Licensed 14th June, 1693.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
